intro: Wulfenia bonarota var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, round leaves. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. The species is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
